channel.title: Reggae production help?
channel.description:
I would love to know how to produce reggae but I haven’t got a clue. Has anyone’s ever tried to produce reggae?
Any tips would be awesome.

item.title: Reggae production help?

item.description:
What’s the ideal bpm for reggae?

Read full topic

item.title: Reggae production help?
item.dc:creator: Southborne
item.description:
Swing it, throw all the chords on the off beat. Minor keys are the norm. Sorry to over simplify but you’ll find it helps

Read full topic

item.title: Reggae production help?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
I’m still unsure if the OP needed help with production, composition or simply inspiration, but I pulled this from my bookmarks which hopefully covers all three.

http://daily.redbullmusicacademy.com/reggae-collection

Read full topic

item.title: Reggae production help?
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
Reggae is not Reggaeton. It’s very different.
Reggaeton and Moombahton are similar, but Reggae is a completely different party animal.

Reggaeton is Latin (Hispanic) Pop music, made with the same beat, at 100 bpm.
Moombahton is the cheesy American version of Reggaeton.
I could say something about Reggae, but I know much less about Reggae than I do about Reggaeton and Moombahton (I know nothing about genres as well), so I’ll let others explain.

Read full topic

item.title: Reggae production help?

item.description:
I thought they were similar at least style wise.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Reggae production help?
item.dc:creator: PISTOL
item.description:
Well I’m a complete novice, ideally the beat and the bassline. I’m sure I can download some dub samples that I can use.

Do you have any of your own dub tracks that I could listen to for inspiration?

item.title: Reggae production help?

item.description:

I’m happy to share what I know, but I’d need a little more detail as to what you’re having trouble with…
